suncertify.db
Class DataValidator

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.DataValidator
final class DataValidator
extends java.lang.Object

Validates the data and throws exceptions as appropriate. Used as a utility to validate the fields for correctness. This is not expected to be sub-classes and is expected to be used as a static validation utility.

Version:
1.2
Author:
Rohit Sood

validateRecordNumber

public static boolean validateRecordNumber(java.lang.String recNo)
                                    throws ValidationException
Validates record number. Checks for null ids, zero length entries, spaces, and formats.

Parameters:
recNo - The record number to validate.
Returns:
true if record number is valid.
Throws:
ValidationException - thrown with a particular failure reason.

validate

public static boolean validate(java.lang.String[] data)
                        throws ValidationException
Validates the data contained in the string array passed in. Individually calls validation on each data item contained in the array.

Parameters:
data - The array to be validated.
Returns:
true if all fields are valid.
Throws:
ValidationException - captures validation error messages

validateHotelName

public static boolean validateHotelName(java.lang.String hotelName)
                                 throws ValidationException
Validates hotel name. Checks for null and boundary lengths for hotel name. If a validation fails, a ValidationException is thrown with an appropriate message.

Parameters:
hotelName - the name of the hotel to be validated
Returns:
trueif hotel name is valid.
Throws:
ValidationException - captures validation error message.

validateCityName

public static boolean validateCityName(java.lang.String cityName)
                                throws ValidationException
Validates City Name. The city name is invalid if its null, less than the minimum length or greater than the maximum specified field length.

Parameters:
cityName - The city name to validate.
Returns:
true is the city is valid.
Throws:
ValidationException - If a validation error occurs.

validateDate

public static boolean validateDate(java.lang.String date)
                            throws ValidationException
Validates date. Date is invalid if it is null, not in the correct format, before the current system date or any other data issue.

Parameters:
date - The date to validate.
Returns:
true if date is valid.
Throws:
ValidationException - Is thrown if date is invalid.

Returns:

isBookable

public static boolean isBookable(java.lang.String[] data,
                                 java.lang.String maxCount,
                                 java.lang.String customerId)
                          throws ValidationException
Validates a record for booking. A record is not bookable if customer id is invalid, or room is more than 48 hours in the future from now, or the room is already booked, or the date of availability is less than 48 hours from now.

Parameters:
data - The data record to validate.
maxCount - The max occupancy of the booking. This should be less than the max occupancy of the room.
customerId - The customer id against whom the bookin should be made.
Returns:
true if the record allowed to be booked by the customer, for the date with the given number of guests.
Throws:
ValidationException - If the record is not available.
